column4: If I install the ATI proprietary graphics drivers, is there a chance that will help my audio and wireless issues, too?
extremely unlikely.
didn't think so, lol.
try googling them with "Ubuntu 7.04 help" or something like that
whats your audio chipset?
ATI Technologies Inc SB450 HDA Audio
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=415821&page=3
no prob.
with wireless, you might just have to wing it, and work on it after the install is done
I might, but that's a last resort, I told her I'd have this up and running before she got home from work. :X
what type of wireless device does lspci identify it as?
Realtek Semiconductor Co., Ltd. RTL-8185 IEEE 802.11a/b/g Wireless LAN Controller (rev 20)
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=416993     2nd post
the link to launchpad?
i was just googling, saw one post said it should work
is that a wireless PCI card?
nope, it's built in to the laptop
found this in my /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist:  # buggy driver causes kernel BUG on load (Ubuntu: #78255, #88430)
i know very little about wireless, so i'm not sure.
wel,l unblack list it, you're on tyhe live CD, so it shouldn't be to big a deal, worst that happens is you restart
ndiswrapper should do the trick
